Detailed Description

This class manages sets of channels.

Member Function Documentation

INLINE const Address & Mercury::NetworkInterface::address (  )  const

This method returns the address of the interface this is bound to or the address of the first non-local interface if it's bound to all interfaces.

A zero address is returned if the interface couldn't initialise.

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::attach ( EventDispatcher &  mainDispatcher  ) 

This method initialises this object.

Packet *  pPacket 
)

Basic packet sending function that just tries to send once.

Returns:
0 on success otherwise an error code.

Reason Mercury::NetworkInterface::basicSendWithRetries ( const Address &  addr,
Packet *  pPacket 
)

Basic packet sending functionality that retries a few times if there are transitory errors.

Channel * Mercury::NetworkInterface::findChannel ( const Address &  addr,
bool  createAnonymous = false 
)

This method returns a channel to the input address.

Parameters:
addr The address of the channel to find.
createAnonymous If set and the channel is not found, a new channel will be created and returned.
Returns:
A pointer to a channel to the given address. If none is found and createAnonymous is false, NULL is returned.

ChannelPtr Mercury::NetworkInterface::findCondemnedChannel ( ChannelID  channelID  )  const

This method finds the condemned channel with the indexed ChannelID.

NetworkInterface::IndexedChannelFinderResult Mercury::NetworkInterface::findIndexedChannel ( ChannelID  channelID,
const Mercury::Address &  srcAddr,
Packet *  pPacket,
ChannelPtr &  rpChannel 
) const

This method finds the channel associated with a given id.

Parameters:
channelID The id of the channel to find.
srcAddr The address that the packet came from.
pPacket The packet that's requesting to find the channel. It is possible that the registered finder will handle the packet immediately.
rpChannel A reference to a channel pointer. This will be set to the found channel.
Returns:
An enumeration indicating whether the channel was found (anything but INDEXED_CHANNEL_CORRUPTED) and whether the packet has already been handled (either INDEXED_CHANNEL_HANDLED or INDEXED_CHANNEL_NOT_HANDLED).

INLINE Channel & Mercury::NetworkInterface::findOrCreateChannel ( const Address &  addr  ) 

This method finds the channel with the given address.

If none is found, a new channel is created.

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::processUntilChannelsEmpty ( float  timeout = 10.f  ) 

This method processes events until all registered channels have no unacked packets, and there are no more unacked once-off packets.

WatcherPtr Mercury::NetworkInterface::pWatcher (  )  [static]

This method returns a watcher that can inspect a NetworkInterface.

const PacketReceiverStats & Mercury::NetworkInterface::receivingStats (  )  const

This method returns a object containing the stats associated with receiving for this interface.

bool Mercury::NetworkInterface::recreateListeningSocket ( uint16  listeningPort,
const char *  listeningInterface 
)

This method discards the existing socket and attempts to create a new one with the given parameters.

The interfaces served by a nub are re-registered on the new socket if successful.

Parameters:
listeningPort The port to listen on.
listeningInterface The network interface to listen on.
Returns:
true if successful, otherwise false.

bool Mercury::NetworkInterface::registerChannel ( Channel &  channel  ) 

This method registers a channel with this interface.

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::registerChannelFinder ( ChannelFinder *  pFinder  ) 

This method sets the ChannelFinder to be used for resolving channel ids.

Reason Mercury::NetworkInterface::registerWithMachined ( const std::string &  name,
int  id 
)

This method is used to register or deregister an interface with the machine guard (a.k.a.

machined).

bool Mercury::NetworkInterface::rescheduleSend ( const Address &  addr,
Packet *  pPacket 
)

This method reschedules a packet to be sent to the address provided some short time in the future (or drop it) depending on the latency settings on the nub.

Returns:
true if rescheduled

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::send ( const Address &  address,
Bundle &  bundle,
Channel *  pChannel = NULL 
)

This method sends a bundle to the given address.

Note: any pointers you have into the packet may become invalid after this call (and whenever a channel calls this too).

Parameters:
address The address to send to.
bundle The bundle to send
pChannel The Channel that is sending the bundle. (even if the bundle is not sent reliably, it is still passed through the filter associated with the channel).

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::sendIfDelayed ( Channel &  channel  ) 

Sends on a channel immediately if it has been registered previously for delayed sending.

const SendingStats& Mercury::NetworkInterface::sendingStats (  )  const [inline]

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::sendPacket ( const Address &  address,
Packet *  pPacket,
Channel *  pChannel,
bool  isResend 
)

This method sends a packet.

No result is returned as it cannot be trusted. The packet may never get to the other end.

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::sendRescheduledPacket ( const Address &  address,
Packet *  pPacket,
Channel *  pChannel 
)

This method sends the packet after rescheduling has occurred.

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::setIrregularChannelsResendPeriod ( float  seconds  ) 

This method sets the period that irregular channels are resent.

INLINE void Mercury::NetworkInterface::setLatency ( float  latencyMin,
float  latencyMax 
)

This method sets the minimum and maximum latency associated with this interface.

If non-zero, packets will be randomly delayed before they are sent.

Parameters:
latencyMin The minimum latency in seconds
latencyMax The maximum latency in seconds

INLINE void Mercury::NetworkInterface::setLossRatio ( float  lossRatio  ) 

This method sets the average packet loss for this interface.

If non-zero, packets will be randomly dropped, and not sent.

Parameters:
lossRatio The ratio of packets to drop. Setting to 0.0 disables artificial packet dropping. 1.0 means all packets are dropped.

INLINE void Mercury::NetworkInterface::setPacketMonitor ( PacketMonitor *  pPacketMonitor  ) 

This method registers a handler to monitor sent/received packets.

Only a single monitor is supported. To remove the monitor, set it to NULL.

Parameters:
pPacketMonitor An object implementing the PacketMonitor interface.

bool Mercury::NetworkInterface::shouldUseChecksums (  )  const [inline]

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::shouldUseChecksums ( bool  b  )  [inline]

Endpoint& Mercury::NetworkInterface::socket (  )  [inline]

void Mercury::NetworkInterface::stopPingingAnonymous (  ) 

This method prepares this network interface for shutting down.

It will stop pinging anonymous channels.
